str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
